info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 5:28PM EDT until July 21 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Orange County in central Virginia... Northeastern Albemarle County in central Virginia... Southern Greene County in central Virginia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 528 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stanardsville, or 13 miles north of Charlottesville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Stanardsville, Free Union, Campbell, Westmoreland, Hollymead, Gordonsville, Ruckersville, Cobham, Quinque, Cismont, Boonesville, Eheart, Barboursville, Keswick, Stony Point, Haneytown, Carrsbrook, Earlysville, Newtown and Amicus. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
